title: Sri Lanka 3-month Treasuries up across maturities
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasuries yields rose across maturities at Wednesday’s auction with the three month yield up 96 basis points to 10.29 percent, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office offered 20 billion rupees of 3 month bills and sold 59.3 billion rupees.
The debt office offered 60 billion rupees of bills and sold 60 billion.
Sri Lanka has allowed market rates to go and also said the rupee has been floated to end a foreign exchange crisis. (Colombo/Mar09/2022)
